Customized Time Management System: To tackle the feeling of jealousy when seeing others complete their tasks seamlessly, you could create a customized time management system that works best for you. This system could involve breaking down your tasks into smaller, manageable chunks, setting realistic deadlines, and allocating specific times of the day for each task. By having a clear plan and structure in place, you'll feel more in control and less overwhelmed, reducing the likelihood of jealousy.

Mindfulness Practice: Practicing mindfulness can help you cultivate a sense of gratitude and appreciation for your own progress, rather than comparing yourself to others. You could try incorporating mindfulness meditation into your daily routine, focusing on your breath and letting go of any thoughts or emotions that arise. This will help you stay present and centered, rather than getting caught up in feelings of jealousy.

Creative Outlet: Engaging in a creative activity can be a great way to channel your emotions and distract yourself from feelings of jealousy. Try picking up a new hobby, such as painting, writing, or playing an instrument. The act of creating something can be therapeutic and help you focus on your own progress, rather than comparing yourself to others.

Self-Care Routine: Taking care of yourself is essential for maintaining a positive mindset and reducing feelings of jealousy. Create a self-care routine that works best for you, including activities such as exercise, reading, or spending time in nature. By prioritizing your own well-being, you'll feel more energized and motivated, reducing the likelihood of jealousy.

Empowering Mantra: Developing an empowering mantra can help you shift your mindset and focus on your own strengths and abilities. Choose a phrase that resonates with you, such as "I am capable and confident" or "I trust myself to handle any challenge." Repeat this mantra to yourself whenever you feel feelings of jealousy arising, to help you stay positive and motivated.
